page.title: 13EGGINTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Egginton School is a small village school in the country. On average there are about 50 pupils. There are three teachers and the Head teaches a class too. The school building is also a memorial hall and lots of different people use it. The school was built in 1857. There is an Infant, a lower junior and an upper junior class. Recently a terrapin building has been put up. There is one main road that goes through the village and the school is on that road. We have a hard playground with hawthorn trees and hedges around the school. There is a post office attached to the school and the caretaker lives there. Rachel Smith
